newsitem.title: CANADA: DBRS confirms Norcen debt ratings.
newsitem.headline: DBRS confirms Norcen debt ratings.

text.p: Dominion Bond Rating Service said on Friday it confirmed its ratings on Norcen Energy Resources Ltd's short and long term debt with stable outlooks.
DBRS said the confirmations covered its BBB (high) rating on Norcen's long-term debt and R-1 (low) rating on commercial paper.
The ratings were confirmed after Norcen launched an offer to buy all of the shares of Basic Petroleum International Ltd for C$440 million.
If successful, the deal would almost double debt levels to about C$1 billion, representing 40 percent of capitalization, compared to the current 20 percent.
It would also raise Norcen's net debt to cash flow ratio to about 1.5 times from under one times, DBRS said.

"In view of the fact that this would result in an immediate rise in proven producing reserve, at reasonable cost (in relation to projected cash flow), has a fast pay back and would be cash flow and earnings attractive, these ratios are acceptable," DBRS said.
